meanings.definition: Able or likely to shatter or burst apart.
meanings.sent1: The fireworks were so explosive that they lit up the night sky.
meanings.sent2: The volcano erupted with an explosive force, sending ash into the air.
meanings.sent3: The birthday party was explosive with excitement as the guests arrived.
meanings.sent4: Her temper was like an explosive volcano, ready to erupt at any moment.
meanings.sent5: The car crash was so explosive that it shook the entire neighborhood.

meanings.definition: A substance that is capable of exploding.
meanings.sent1: The soldiers carefully handled the explosive to avoid any accidents.
meanings.sent2: The demolition expert placed the explosive charges strategically.
meanings.sent3: The chef's new recipe was an explosive mix of flavors that delighted the customers.
meanings.sent4: The secret agent planted the explosive device in the enemy's headquarters.
meanings.sent5: The fireworks display featured a variety of colorful explosives that lit up the sky.
